transcript:
which was apt to master him with great suddenness and prompt him to the coarsest and most reckless actions. 
After tea, the company went into the sitting room and Princess Mary was asked to play on the clavichord. Anatole, laughing and in high spirits, came and leaned on his elbows, facing her and beside Mademoiselle Bourienne. Prin- cess Mary felt his look with a painfully joy- ous emotion. Her favorite sonata bore her in- to a most intimately poetic world and the look she felt upon her mad
